byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan, and Mohammad Fahim Abed from Kabul, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By NAJIM RAHIM and MUJIB MASHAL

abstract: Almost eight months after Afghan forces reclaimed Kunduz City, Taliban still retains control of much of province; situation in Kunduz points to larger struggle for security forces as they remain largely unable to turn back gains made by Taliban insurgents.

headline.print_headline: Afghan Forces Fail to Reverse Taliban’s Gains
headline.main: Afghan Forces Fail to Turn Back Taliban Gains

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The struggle to take control in Kunduz districts reflects a broader problem for the Afghan security forces, with months of the Taliban’s offensive still ahead....
lead_paragraph: The struggle to take control in Kunduz districts reflects a broader problem for the Afghan security forces, with months of the Taliban’s offensive still ahead.
